The term  generally refers to the basic services and amenities that are necessary to sustain and improve the quality of life in urban areas. These services may include things like transportation, waste management, water supply and sanitation, public safety, healthcare, education, and social services. Urban services are essential for ensuring that cities and urban areas are livable and functional, and that their residents can enjoy a decent standard of living. They are typically provided by local governments or other service providers, and may be funded through a combination of taxes, user fees, and other sources of revenue.
